result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Michael Cardinali was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  *Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. No THC.   Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Probation & Parole to notify the court, in writing, of any arrests or violations within 5 days of receipt of information.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Michael Cardinali

records.addlTxt: of DNA Collection at Conviction
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Walworth County ADA James Sempf appears for the State.   Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Patton.  Clerk. M.Burke. State will be filing an amended information. Amended information stated on the record by ADA Sempf. DE pleads guilty to counts 1, 2 and 3 of the amended information. Court finds DE guilty of counts 1, 2 and 3. Court withholds sentence and places DE on 2 years probation with conditions. Credit for 1 day served if revoked. DE to submit DNA sample and pay $600 DNA surcharge. DNA notice given to DE in court.
